intro: Bulbostylis macra, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often arranged in dense clusters along the stem. Bulbostylis macra is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of water bodies.
